TravelTriangle > Blog > Andhra Pradesh > 9 Mesmerising Hill Stations In Andhra Pradesh For A Scenic Getaway In 2025 9 Mesmerising Hill Stations In Andhra Pradesh For A Scenic Getaway In 2025 .. SHARES Updated Date: 28 February 2025 If you are planning to visit a hill station this summer, then Andhra Pradesh can be the perfect getaway. This beautiful state has some of the most mesmerizing hill stations in the entire Indian subcontinent. These beautiful hill stations in Andhra Pradesh are a blessing to the tourists and all the local Andhra people, because they surely do help you get rid of the scorching city heat. The hill stations feature soothing weather, verdant greenery, lush landscapes and a picturesque experience to the travellers. Then take a look at our list where we have mentioned the best hill destinations in the state. Table Of Content Top 9 Hill Stations In Andhra Pradesh If you ever want to enjoy lush greenery or explore hiking trails in Andhra Pradesh, then remember you have a variety of options here. Here is a list of all the beautiful and famous hill stations in Andhra Pradesh that you should note down in your travel journal. Visit any of these places for your next getaway in the state. Araku Valley – Enigmatic & Soul-Soothing Horsley Hills – Different Sense Of Aura Nallamala Hills – Largest Hill Station In Andhra Lambasingi – Kashmir Of Andhra Pradesh Ananthagiri Hills – Teeming With Wildlife Swamimalai Hills – Hiker’s Haven Nagari Hills – Perfect Weekend Getaway Papikondalu – Expect The Unexpected Nagalapuram – A Small Yet Elegant Town 1. Araku Valley – Enigmatic & Soul-Soothing One of the most famous places to visit in Andhra Pradesh, Araku Valley is an enigmatic location where you can rejuvenate your mind and relax in the most amazing manner. The hill station is surrounded by lush greenery and natural flora and fauna. The soul-soothing climate of the Araku Valley makes it a tourist hotspot in Andhra Pradesh. There are a series of caves, waterfalls, brooklets and many other natural features available in the area. The valley is located about 115 km from Vizag and is about 1300m from the ocean level. The area offers a number of physical activities that can be done. The drive from the Ghat Street to the Araku is lined with beautiful landscapes making it a very attractive picnic spot for the locals. If you are wondering the best hill stations in Andhra Pradesh for family, Araku Valley is one of them. Must see places in Araku: Araku Tribal Museum, Borra Caves, Damku ViewPoint, Sangda Waterfalls. How to reach: By Air – The nearest airport to Araku is Vishakhapatnam Airport (110 km) By Rail – Araku Jn. is where trains coming from Visakhapatnam make a stop. Best time to visit: October to March Places To Stay: Ushodaya Resorts, Sri Sai Suvarna Inn, The Village Villa Resorts & Restaurants, Fairyland, Rahul Resorts  Ideal Duration: 1 Day Must Read: 8 Charming Places To Visit In Vizag In Summer For Your Trip To Andhra Pradesh South Weekend Holiday Packages On TravelTriangle Delightful South Weekend Tour 3D/2N Package @ Rs 4,999 Plan your trip today! Horsley Hills – Different Sense Of Aura A small hamlet in the cluster of mountains and valleys the state of Andhra Pradesh, Horsley Hills have captivated the tourists for a long period of time. This particular place has a different sense of aura once again. Home to one of the wildlife sanctuaries in Andhra Pradesh, the wonderful hill station is covered with dense vegetation and rich flora and fauna. Named after the then collector of Kadapa District – WD Horsley, this hilly location is situation 1,265 m from the sea-level. If you want to get away from the warm weather and hot heat waves, Horsley Hills seem to be a good option. There are a variety of things to do in Horsley Hills to have a memorable vacation. Make sure to trek and hike around the natural trails to experience the true beauty of the hill station and witness nature from very up close. Must see places near Horsley Hills: Kaundinya Wildlife Sanctuary, Mallamma Temple, Tirupati How to reach: By Air – The nearest airport to Horsley Hills is Bangalore (around 160 km) By Rail: Madanapalle Road Jn. (45 km) is the nearest railway station. Best time to visit: April to June, September to November Places To Stay: Horsley Hills holiday Homes, Sri Vijaya Residency A/C, Tripura Sundari Residency, Sln Grand Ideal Duration: 2 days Suggested Read: 9 Cool Places To Visit In Summer In Andhra Pradesh To Beat The Heat 3. Nallamala Hills – Largest Hill Station In Andhra Easily one of the top 10 hill stations in Andhra Pradesh, Nallamala Hills is the largest hill station in the whole of Andhra Pradesh. You’ll be surprised to know that the hills spread over 5 different districts. The hills have an elevation of 3608 feet and that makes it a candidate for one of the highest hill stations in the Indian subcontinent. From pristine rivers, forests, valleys, orchards, and many other natural phenomenon to discover, Nallamala Hills is the perfect getaway for any adventurous person. The subtle climate and easy to navigate locations, makes your expedition more enjoyable. There are several home-stays and lodge available here. Must see places in Nallamala Hills – Cumbum Lake, Srisailam Temple, Nagarjunasagar Srisailam Sanctuary How to reach: By Air – The nearest airport is the Hyderabad Airport (232 km) By Rail – Hyderabad Railway Station is the closest to the hills situated on the Hubli-Guntur Route Best time to visit: March to May, September to November Places To Stay: Srisaileswara Dormitory A/C, AP Tourism Hotel, Pathaleswara Sadanam, Velma Choultry, Vasavi Satram, Hotel Grand Akkamahadevi Ideal Duration: 1 day Suggested Read: 7 Breathtakingly Beautiful Mahabalipuram Temples That Are The Soul Of South India! 4. Lambasingi – Kashmir Of Andhra Pradesh An off-beat and romantic hill station, Lambasingi is easily one of the most sought-after hill stations in Andhra Pradesh for couples. Many a times this hill station is referred to as the “Kashmir of Andhra Pradesh” because of the heavenly landscape and superb natural fauna. The fresh and soothing atmosphere around the place makes it the perfect getaway from the daily life in the city. The surrounding low lying moist deciduous forest cover helps to consistently maintain tranquilizing weather year-round. You will come across several plantations available in the area. Also, Lambasingi in summer is an absolute delight as it is one of the coolest places in Andhra Pradesh, with temperatures falling to as low as 0°C during the winter season. Must see places in Lambasingi: Kothapally Waterfalls, Hope Island How to reach: Visakhapatnam (100km) is the nearest city to the hill station and can be accessed by bus or private cars. One can reach Visakhapatnam by air or rail accessible from the whole country. Best time to visit: November to January. April to June. Places To Stay: Jungle camping lambasingi, Siddartha Residency, Treebo Trend Excella, Treebo PL Grand, Akshara Comforts Ideal Duration: 1 – 2 days Suggested Read: 10 Amazing Things To Do In Pachmarhi For A Fun-Filled Getaway In The Heart Of India 5. Ananthagiri Hills – Teeming With Wildlife One of the most popular hill stations in Andhra Pradesh, Ananthagiri Hills is around 10 km from Vikarabad. The hill station is surrounded at the base by the Osman Sagar and Himayat Sagar. It is noted for its dense jungle cover and magnificent views of the surrounding low lying areas. The Musi River flows through the area and contributes to the verdant greenery and teeming wildlife in Ananthagiri. This hill station is a perfect destination for many hikers and trekkers who want to experience something adventurous. You’ll come across a lot of medieval forts and old temples in Andhra Pradesh spread over the area which tells you that once, this area held significant importance in the history of South India and Andhra Pradesh. A road trip to Ananthagiri Hills is also a great idea to execute. Must see places in Ananthagiri – Bhavanasi Lake, Araku Valley, Muchukunda River How to reach: By Rail – Srikakulam (3 km) is the nearest station to access this beautiful destination and By road – State transport buses regularly from Visakhapatnam and Hyderabad. Best time to visit: October to March. Places To Stay: R Banquets And A/C Rooms, Ansari Bagh, Sri Durga Residency, Hotel Aveka, Button Eyes Resort – Pet friendly Ideal Duration: 1-2 days Suggested Read: 15 Places To Visit Near Madurai: The Gateway To Enjoying South India’s Beauty 6. Swamimalai Hills – Hiker’s Haven Situated close to Tirupati, the Swamimalai Hills is a famous hill station in Andhra Pradesh that houses the highest peak of 4626 ft. above sea level, Yelagiri. Due to the significant height and mountainous features, the place is a great chance for hikers and trekkers to explore and experience the aura of this place. Swamimalai Trek is a popular trek nowadays and is commences from the Mangalam Village that is around 3.5 kilometres from Punganoor Lake. The trek is about 5-6 kms both uphill and downhill. From the moment you visit Swamimalai, you will be surprised to witness the scenic beauty of this place and the breathtaking scenery that is worth a picture. Must see places in Swamimalai – Jalagamparai Falls, Perumal Temple, Nilavoor Lake, Velavan Temple and Fundera Park. How to reach: By Air – Tirupati Airport is the nearest airport to Tirumala which is at a distance of 35 km away By rail – Tirupati Railway station and Renigunta Station (38 km). Best time to visit – September to December. February to April. Places To Stay: Lp Castle, Summer Stay’s, Cloud 9 Resort, Cloud 9 Luxury Villas Ideal Duration: 2 days Suggested Read: 42 Famous Historical Places In India To Visit 7. Nagari Hills – Perfect Weekend Getaway Located only to the North ot Nagari town, the Nagari Hills is the best hill stations in Andhra Pradesh to visit during the summers for a perfect getaway from the scorching heat. The highest peak of this hill is situated at a height of 855 m from the sea level. The charming beauty and panoramic views of the hill station makes Nagari Hills one of the best valleys in Andhra Pradesh during summers. This place attracts a lot of photographers and nature enthusiasts from all over the country. Nagari Hills is often known for being a great picnic spot for the locals in the area. Must see places near Nagari: Kaundinya Wildlife Sanctuary, Tirupati, Gurramkonda Fort. How to reach: By Rail: Renigunta Railway Station (35 km) is the nearest railway station to Nagari By Air: Tirupati Airport is 50 km away Best time to visit – Year round Places To Stay: Jayalakshmi Residency, Appanna Rest House, Sri Muni Residency, Hotel Welcome Tirupati, Springhill Serviced Apartments Ideal Duration: 2 days Suggested Read: 13 Gorgeous Waterfalls In Andhra Pradesh That Will Make You High On Beauty 8. Papikondalu – Expect The Unexpected What you expect from a hill station, you get at Papikondalu. A serene and magnanimously beautiful hill station, Papikondalu is covered with Papi hills, rain forests and the mighty Godavari river flowing through the place. The forests have plenty of trekking tails, camping grounds and waterfalls that flow across the valley. The lovely scenery and peaceful atmosphere makes Papikondalu a must visit hill station. You must definitely boat from Rajahmundry or Bhadrachalam in the small streams to get the true essence of Papikondalu’s landscape. Do opt for a resort stay amidst the lush green forests for a satisfying vacation. Must see places in Papikondalu: Papikonda National Park, Munivaatam waterfall, Pattiseema, Perantallapalli village, Gandi Pochamma Temple, Papi hills, Jamalapuram Temple How to reach: By Air – Rajahmundry airport is the nearest one at just 60 km away By Rail – Rajahmundry railway station serves as the major railhead where important trains from Visakhapatnam, Hyderabad and Warangal stop. Best time to visit: October to March Places To Stay: Papikondalu Resorts, Birds Nest Resorts & Tourism, River Bay Resort, SK Riviera, Aranya Eco Resorts Ideal Duration: 2 days Suggested Read: 3 Zoos In Andhra Pradesh Where You Can Interact With Wildlife 9. Nagalapuram – A Small Yet Elegant Town Nagalapuram is a very small town situated in Chittoor district and popular for its temples, waterfalls, trekking routes and vast forests. Trekking is the most popular activity undertaken by tourists visiting Nagalapuram. The glory of the place lies in the lush green hills and natural beauty that comes with it.  A true paradise for adventure seekers, Nagalapuram is one of the best offbeat adventure destinations in Andhra Pradesh. It’s popular but not frequently visited therefore with an immense potential for a secluded time within the natural settings. Must see places in Nagalapuram: Nagalapuram falls, Vedanarayana Swamy temple, Sri Pallikondeswara Swamy Temple, Kailasakona Waterfalls, Ubbalamadugu Falls How to reach: By Air – Tirupati Airport is the closest to Nagalapuram at just 50 km away By Rail – The major railway station is Tirupati where major trains from all over India halt as Tirupati is a major junction Best time to visit: October to March Places To Stay: Ve Vin Lodge, Haritha Valley Resort Ideal Duration: 2 days Further Read: 18 Best Places To Visit In India During Christmas Holidays For A Grand Celebration In 2020 These are the few hill stations in Andhra pradesh which can offer you a great escape for a few days and help you refresh your mind and relax your body. Make sure to confirm your tickets and hotel bookings before you take a vacation in Andhra Pradesh. Frequently Asked Questions About Hill Stations In Andhra Pradesh Which is the coolest place in Andhra Pradesh? Lambasingi is the coolest place in Andhra Pradesh where temperatures can get as low as 0°C during the winter season at times. Which is the highest place in Andhra Pradesh? Arma Konda is the highest mountain peak and one of the coolest place in Andhra Pradesh at 1,680 meters (5,510 ft). How do I get to Lambasingi? Visakhapatnam (100 km) is the nearest place to the hill station and can be accessed by Bus or private cars. One can reach Visakhapatnam by air or rail accessible from the whole country. Which is the best time to visit Araku? October to March is the best time to visit Araku Valley in the state of Andhra Pradesh. Does Lambasingi have snow? Yes. Snowfall has been recorded in Lambasingi but only during the years when the temperature was below 0°C. This is a big reason that Lambasingi is coolest place in Andhra Pradesh. Where is the Nallamala forest located? Nallamal Forest is located in Kurnool and is a part of the Eastern Ghats. How difficult is Swamimalai trek? It is a 3 km trek each way with a steep and uphill trail. While it can be a bit difficult for novice and firs-timers, regular hikers won't find it difficult. Looking To Book A Holiday Package?
